IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Provide skilled, long-term care, residential care and rehabilitation for veterans, their spouses , widows, widowers and gold star parents at six facilities in Maine.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Provide skilled, long-term care and rehabilitation services for veterans, their spouses , widows, and widowers.
IRS990.Description: Nursing Home Care: The Bangor facility has 150 beds and provided 52,483 days of resident care.

Activity2.Description: Nursing Home Care: The Scarborough facility has 150 beds and provided 52,072 days of resident care.

Activity3.Description: Nursing Home Care: The Augusta facility has 150 beds and provided 51,444 days of resident care.

ActivityOther.Description: The Caribou facility has 70 beds and provided 23,351 days of resident care. South Paris facility has 90 beds and provided 31,840 days of resident care. The Machias facility has 30 beds and provided 10,753 of resident care. The newly constructed MVH Pharmacy started operations in June of 2010 and provides medication and consulting services to all of Maine Veterans Homes.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: Maine Veterans Homes lobbying costs include a portion of dues paid to the Maine Health Care Association. It also includes the preparation of documents and research in the support of State and Federal legislation by the law firms of Larouche and Dyer and Piper Rudnick. Tax year 2009 was an unusually active year for Maine Veterans Homes with regard to lobbying, because we took the lead nationally in finding a solution to the problems caused for numerous states by the implementation of P.L. 109-461.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Other liabilities consist of Estimated 3rd party settlements, which are amounts we have estimated that we will owe the State of Maine, as well as Post Employment Health Insurance, which is estimated as a benefit paid to former employees.
Rental loss of 1,744 is a revenue on this schedule and as an expense on the audited financial statements.

Contractual allowances 18,128,048 were added to revenue for this schedule to show gross, but net is used on the audited financial statements. Investment management fees of 15,126 were added to revenue for this schedule as the audited financial statement was net of these fees. They are then expensed on the expense schedule.
Rental loss of 1744 is a revenue on this schedule and as an expense on the audited financial statements.

Rental income is a negative revenue on this schedule -1744 but as an expense on the audited financial statements. Contractual allowances -18,128,048 are negative on this schedule as net revenue on the audited financial statements. Charity care of 179,318 is on this schedule but netted out of revenues on the audited financial statements.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Kelley Kash, Chief Executive Officer can be reached at 207-622-0075.
Maine Veterans Homes constructed a new pharmacy at its current central office location. The MVH Pharmacy will provide medication and consulting services for our six locations.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The first draft of the 990 return will be completed by MVH Finance staff, using the information from the audited financial statements, and reveiwed by the CEO, CFO, Controller and Assistant Controller two weeks prior to the January Board meeting. The draft of the 990 return is then reveiwed by our independant accountants and changes are made. On the day prior to the scheduled full January Board meeting, the Board Finance Committee meets to review the draft of the 990. The draft of the 990 is then presented to the full Board at the January Board meeting for acceptance or rejection. If the return is rejected, MVH staff shall research changes and adjust the 990 return according to the Board reccommendations. The updated return will be presented to the Board Executive Committee for final approval no later than February 10th. Immediatley upon Board approval, the 990 return is submitted to the IRS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Maine Veterans Homes regularly and consistently monitors the compliance program through a variety of mechanisms, including internal and external audits, two party approval for purchasing and payments and a compliance 'hotline' reporting tool. Recurring internal audits are performed throughout the year in all functions. An external audit is conducted by an independent auditor annually, including looking at all areas of potential conflict of interest (COI). Finally, MVH has a 24 hour, toll free compliance hotline that staff or public may report any concerns or issues, including COI. These will be investigated by the Compliance Officer who reports directly to the Board on such matters. For Board business that involves any potential COI, the member is required to recuse himself from the decision making process and it is documented in the Board minutes.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: When hiring officers, Maine Veterans Homes determines salaries for these positions based on market demand for similiar positions within the long term care industry and within ranges acceptable to the general public. Maine Veterans Homes is a quasi-state agency of the State of Maine. As such, its records are available to the public.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Financial Statements: Available to the public on "GuideStar" website and upon request by the public. Governing documents: MVH was established by State statute and this statute is available to the public through various means, including internet access from the State of Maine website. Governing documents: Available upon request from the public. Conflict of Interest Policy: As a quasi-state agency, all written policies, including the Conflict of Interest policy, are available to the public upon request.
Other liabilities consist of Estimated 3rd party settlements of 341,671 and Post employment health insurance benefits, both current and long term of 539,750.
In memory of her spouse that was cared for at our Scarborough facility, the resident's spouse donated a duet bicycle that was purchased for 5850 dollars on June 16 2010

ReasonableCauseExplanation.Explanation: An extension was filed and granted by the IRS. Audited financial statements are not prepared in time to meet the November filing deadline.
